intro: Unifolium sessilifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed grass. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its narrow, sessile leaves that are typically arranged in a basal rosette. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of the grass family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
